author: Angela LaFace
text: 'Went from dessert & cappuccino‚Ä¶. Slightly busy
column5: with only one waitress‚Ä¶ the bus boy tried to help us but he couldn‚Äôt answer any questions‚Ä¶ waitress came over
column6: very friendly & we ordered off the dessert menu‚Ä¶ we got out drinks & desserts shortly after‚Ä¶ the yogurt parfait was frozen‚Ä¶ after it thawed and was mixed it was delicious. Cheesecake was just your basic cheesecake nothing fancy. We then noticed the specials‚Ä¶ had we been told about the specials we totally would‚Äôve gotten that from the get go‚Ä¶ we got a tiramisu to go‚Ä¶. Now that was amazing!'

author: Richard Seickendick
text: 'Apps were good chicken parm was ok had better
column5: owners where hanging out in front of door not professional for a local restaurant also since eating outside saw cooks who wore regular cloths not chef uniforms come out to smoke at least 4 times which was unappeling and kinda ruined my appetite to see kitchen staff looking so unprofessional walking in and our in front of outdoor dining guest to take smoking breaks and looking unclean and  this turned me off so will not be returning.'

author: John Ortiz
text: "A place that feels like home.\nFrom the food to the atmosphere to the fast friendly service
column5: they make you feel like you've always been there. Highly recommended."

author: Anna Targosz
text: 'Old fashioned
column5: traditional Italian food and serving! We celebrated friends birthday with BYOB!'

author: Erika Bracy
text: 'While the food was fabulous
column5: we were a party of 7 with an 8th person who joined us just for company
column6: not for food
column7: and there was only one other table of 3 seated the entire time we were there.\n\nEverything was great until it came to the end.  They did not offer an itemized receipt
column8: just one that had prices on it. It was extremely unclear if they added gratuity or not
column9: and we couldn\'t tell what item the prices belonged to.\n\nHowever
column10: the real issue I had was when the server came to collect water glasses at the end of the night before dropping the check.  Mine was empty
column11: and I asked for more water.  Instead of getting me more
column12: the server hesitated and then said "oh
column13: we are closing" and put a finger in my empty glass to clear it away. Mind you
column14: several of the group still had full glasses of wine.\n\nThe server flat out refused to bring me more water.  This was at 9:20pm
column15:
we had been there since 630/7pm. We had just finished eating dessert and were about to pay the check.  We hadn't even paid yet!

One of my companions graciously offered me her glass of water instead. Refusing to bring water to the table did not cause us to leave any earlier than if the server had said "of course" and brought it.

I would have left only 1 star
column16: but for the food being awesome.\n\nWe were out the door in the rain by 9:40. This is not an unreasonable time on a Monday night to leave a restaurant

author: Timothy Schuster
text: 'One of the best places to go in the area!!!!!!! The staff is unbelievable!!!!!'

text: 'Such lovely ambiance between the servers
column5: family owners
column6: and food. The prices are great and the friendliness of the entire staff makes it even more worth it. My boyfriend loves the vodka chicken parm and I usually get a pasta! 100% recommend Cafe Michelina! They are the best!'

text: 'Went here the other night for outdoor dining and loved the food! I will definitely be back to try the other dishes. We started with mussels in spicy sauce and then I chose the stuffed rigatoni with chicken in vodka sauce while my friend had the lobster ravioli. Would recommend all of them!'

author: Raul J. Pinto
text: 'This no-frills corner restaurant was an unexpected surprise. I stopped here for a quick lunch and was met by fast service and friendly staff. It is clear that this a family-run establishments which adds a positive touch to the experience. I would describe the food as 100% homemade. Our appetizers and main dishes were prepared with care and evident attention to detail. I am quite picky with Italian food and this is a well-deserved five stars. The prices are also reasonable which is not commonplace in Hoboken.'

author: Cornelius Rockefeller
text: 'This is a top notch place. I only ordered the Sweet Mussels
column5: which perfect amount of garlic in the sauce. Highly recommended. The free bread to start went down like water. Farewell and till next time - CC Rockefeller'

text: 'Food was really good just poor service me and my cousin never got checked on

author: Connor Arnell
text: 'This is one of the most overlooked places in Hoboken. I\'ve been to most of the other "great" Italian places in Hoboken
column5: and none of them hold a candle to this place. Sure
column6: the interior and the decor is nothing special
column7: but for some of the places in Hoboken that\'s all they have going for them. I promise though this is some of the best Italian food you\'ll find in the area. Please do yourself a favor and get the zucchini sticks as an appetizer
column8: and their bruschetta is to die for.'

author: Tara Kipel
text: 'Meh. Came for dinner and unfortunately a large party with a lot of loud children were present. They screamed through our whole meal and the family obviously knew the owners so I guess they didn‚Äôt feel the need to be courteous to other diners. My food was fine (although the pasta was slightly over cooked) but the other meal we ordered was shrimp parmigiana and it came unbreaded. Who serves shrimp parmigiana not breaded? When we asked the server (one of 4 or 5 we had that evening -\nseriously
column5: just stick to one server per table) what that was about he said the breadcrumbs aren‚Äôt added because they ‚Äúmask the flavor of the shrimp‚Äù .. never mind that shrimp barely has a flavor anyway but ok
column6: sure. All in all a pretty disappointing experience (and expensive
column7: considering this place doesn‚Äôt serve alcohol) and slightly embarrassing that I brought a guest to dine here. Definitely crossing this one off the list for good.'

column6: etc.'

text: 'Very nice meal and atmosphere üíå'

text: 'Ok place
column5: can be a little pricy if you go for special menu'

author: Ryan Andersen
text: 'My wife and I have been coming here over 5 years
column5: & honestly 5 stars doesn‚Äôt do it enough.  If you want good authentic Italian here‚Äôs the place to go in Hoboken.'

author: Monica Saliceti
text: 'Excellent food and service. Looking forward to visiting again.'

author: Digital Launch
text: 'Always accommodating and ALWAYS great homecooked food'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Made a reservation for 4 people at 6 pm on Mother's Day. We were running a little late
column5: but they were still able to save our table
column6: which was great because it was also the last table available.\n\nEverything started out fine - we brought our own wine
column7: and they brought out the glasses
column8: opened the bottle pretty quickly. Even brought us some complimentary bruschetta. We placed our order - apps and entrees all at once. The calamari did not come out until 40 minutes later. 40 MINUTES! I'm not sure if it was because it was Mother's Day that the service was extremely slow
column9: but judging from some of these other reviews
column10: it seems like that's just the norm here. It wasn't even worth the wait because it was so bland
column11: and it tasted like it was premade or previously frozen.\n\nFor my entree
column12: I had the penne vodka with chicken ($17.95). I liked it
column13: but I'm not sure if it was worth the price tag. The quality is comparable to pizzeria pasta. BF's dad had some seafood pasta. He wanted to change the sauce to pesto but apparently they don't make that. What kind of Italian restaurant cannot make some pesto?? BF and his mom got two different specials of the night: stuffed rigatoni (?) with chicken (it was unclear if it was stuffed WITH chicken or not
column14: but it actually is just stuffed with cheese and served with chicken)
column15: and some chicken dish with mozzarella and spinach
column16: served with penne. We didn't ask how much the specials would be but we probably should have because each of them came out to $24.95. There was definitely a robbery taking place here that night. We still ended up getting dessert since his parents love tiramisu. It was good
column17: but it's nothing I can't buy premade.\n\nBottom line: the price is not worth the quality
column18: and definitely not the slow service."

author: Maria Valente
text: 'Gotta get the stuffed rigatoni with chicken in a vodka sauce!! One of my favs .. Awesome Staff and the cooks sure can cook !!! Love the summer time where you can sit outside and enjoy a meal. Goodjob . Give this place 5 stars!! Def worth coming back to over and over again.'

text: "Delicious

author: Walter Zielenski
text: "Perfect little spot for Italian food!\n\nWith all the upscale
column5: high-end
column6: overpriced Italian places nearby on Washington
column7: Cafe Michelina is a breath of fresh air. It's easy to miss
column9: but it costs 1/3 as much as some of the more expensive places
column10: and tastes at *least* as good. It might look like the old Italian place in your parents' town and drab in comparison to the contemporary spots on Washington
column11: but it's absolutely worth it.\n\nBig portions
column13: and great tasting. It's even BYOB; there's a liquor shop around the other side of Washington Street.\n\nI'd definitely recommend."

author: Nine Rags
text: "Long-time favorite
column5: my group of friends and I have a picture of us on the wall with the owner that's how long time it is"

author: W Gaffney
text: 'This was our first experience at Cafe Michelina. The food was great for the majority of our party.  The service was "tag team waiting".  That is 3 different servers throughout the meal. Chaotic.  No management seemed present. The dining area was tight. Prices for specials weren\'t posted. What I\'ve previously mentioned pales to the check.  Our party received a check for the meal.  On the rear of the check was a written an amount for the gratuity.  We settled the check including the notated gratuity.  We found out much later that the gratuity was already included in the check
column5: meaning we had paid the gratuity TWICE.  Someone had given themselves a nice FORTY PERCENT TIP.  The check seemed steep for a BYOB. I guess they saw us rubes comin and saw payday. Who knows how many customers get banged by this clip act. If you go in a large group make sure you MONITOR YOUR CHARGES and the gratuity.  Nowhere does the check indicate that the gratuity is included in the final tally. Oh well I\'ve vented my spleen
column6: good food but be on guard.'

author: Sergio Panunzio
text: 'Best Italian food on this side of the pond'

column5: and veal parm'

text: 'delicious food

author: Leo S
text: 'Marvellous pastas ! Thank you guys!'

author: David Spektor
text: 'Byob. Great chicken parm and vodka sauce'

author: Lorena D.lorenzo
text: "Love the eggplant parm and pastas with seafood. Pity they don't serve alcohol and service....2 stars!"

author: Bryan Nieto
text: 'Looking for great Italian food? Come to this restaurant and you will not regret it!!'

author: Daryl Williams
text: 'One of my favorite restaurants in Hoboken. Great Italian food in an old school atmosphere!'

author: Ashley Lanza
text: 'My family of 5 and I dined here again this week. We generally come here 1-2 times per month. I‚Äôve got to say
column5: after this week‚Äôs visit
column6: we will not be returning. The food as always was fine. And as per usual
column7: we felt extremely rushed. We were the ONLY party in the entire restaurant; not one other person. We placed our order and once again our entrees hit the table before we finished the appetizer. We had not one but two servers constantly hovering around our table taking plates the moment we finished the last bite. I‚Äôm talking the second you finish your bread
column8: they‚Äôre pulling the bread plate away. It is so ridiculous and uncomfortable. They were asking if we wanted to wrap food to go before we even finished eating! Literally. We could hardly have a conversation because someone was at the table every minute‚Ä¶ that is until the check came. Once the check was dropped
column9: both servers hovered in the back of the restaurant. We added 20% gratuity
column11: only to then realize something wasn‚Äôt adding up. BE MINDFUL OF THIS: They staple TWO receipts to your order. On the BACK of the order form
column12: the waitress calculated her own twenty percent tip and added that to the top receipt‚Äôs total. The second receipt has the total before gratuity. NOWHERE on any receipt will you see the word ‚Äòtip‚Äô or ‚Äògratuity.‚Äô One server came by
column14: and we asked her if the tip was included. She explained that the tip was calculated and included and we could find that on the BACK of the order form and that tip was included for parties of five or more (I‚Äôve never seen this for less than 6 people). VERY SNEAKY. From here on out
column15: our main waitress stayed in the kitchen until we left. The moment we left
column16: literally as we crossed the street
column17: we saw her walk to our table. Luckily we caught this before we handed back the check with an extra 20% tacked on top of her already included gratuity. Not to mention
column18: prices on the receipt do not list which food item it‚Äôs for and these prices do not match the menu. There are about a dozen awesome Italian restaurant in Hoboken I can think of off the top of my head. Visit literally any one of those before coming here. Very sneaky way of doing business and I can‚Äôt imagine how many people must trip an extra 20% not realizing it‚Äôs already included .'

author: Pierantonios Papazoglou
text: 'Cosy
column5: friendly
column6: great food and reasonably priced. Pietro
column7: the owner is a wonderful person. :-)'

author: Pearl Stars
text: 'It is such a cosy place to be in evenings. BOB option is available and the overall atmosphere is very warm and charming. You might need to wait a little because this place gets full. You can also pick this spot to have your regular dinner.'

author: Hilda Figueroa
text: "My first time st this cozy and authentic Italian restaurant
column5: celebrating my Sis Sonia's birthday. The servers were awesome and the food was DELISH!! Will go there again."

author: Xerxes Dotiwalla
text: 'Chef offered us some of his home-grown basil'

author: Clarke Smith
text: 'We have been regular customers of Cafe Michelina over the past two years. I can honestly say that we eat here or order about once a month. In the past few times pickup and delivery service has much to be desired... today will be the last delivery we will order from Caf√© Michelina after we received our favorite dish (here)
column5: the Chicken Michelina with penne. We both ordered the same dish and combined both dishes had leas than 25 pieces of penne. And also
column6: when someone delivers your food
column7: in my book 10% is sufficient as a tip and the guy rolled his eyes.... so we are now cooking extra penne (at home - which defeats the initial purpose of ordering in) to supplement this expensive experience. :(.'
